oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In a peculiar state of the atmosphere, in which sounds can be heard at a considerable distance, sitting, instead of standing, is recommended; for fear of evil consequences. Standing over those who are sitting, on account of its injurious effects, is also objected to, etc. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-20. 5559 rev.-5568 rev.). The !ho can kill people who are standing over visitors and sticks can 'seek people' and 'strike' them dead if they stand still. If a person's teeth are 'above' or over their 'knees' they are standing over other people and can cause their deaths or make them ill. 1) See also The !kho: a blue mist which resembles smoke and The !ho and Ko-boken, 2) This story is found in Book V-20.
